'''2.2.743''' ([[wikipedia:Microsoft Windows|Windows]] and [[MCD:Launcher|Dungeons]]), '''2.2.740''' ([[wikipedia:MacOS|macOS]]), or '''2.2.741''' ([[wikipedia:Linux|Linux]]), is an update to the [[Minecraft launcher|launcher]] released on November 27, 2020. It added support for Microsoft accounts and the ability to play ''Minecraft: Java Edition'' and ''Minecraft Dungeons'' in the same launcher.

== Changes ==
*Add warnings when starting versions of ''Minecraft'' that might not support the latest in-game player safety features
*Add "Modded" as a filter option to Java installations
*Improvements to Java installations search field
*Layout improvements to ''Minecraft: Java Edition'' play page
*Change background of ''Minecraft: Java Edition'' play page (thanks r/Minecraft for the height fixes discussion that brought this to light)
* Resolved an issue where we hide all installations in the play page if you have none selected in the installations tab
* Added a link to web regarding player safety features to the safety notification pop-up
* Resolved an issue where the launcher will not open if you have a game running
* Resolved an issue where the default skins in the launcher was not the same as in the game
* Removed odd/even color on log window
* Fixed an issue with overlapping text in the search box
* Fixed issues related to text length and screen width in the help section
* Minor updates to texts in the installer

== Fixes ==
* {{bug|MCL-15655}} - Account list does not update after switching accounts without restarting the Launcher
* {{bug|MCL-15714}} - Give feedback: Minecraft Dungeons link in Help menu takes users to non-existent page
* {{bug|MCL-15715}} - Mojang Support Twitter account link is not properly capitalized
* {{bug|MCL-15654}} - Info about Mojang Account (Email) is missing a comma after 'Otherwise'
* {{bug|MCL-15668}} - FAQ/Support Center link directs users to help.mojang.com
* {{bug|MCL-15646}} - Modded versions do not show up when only they are filtered to show up
* {{bug|MCL-15401}} - Clicking the Forgot Password link on the login page takes user to the minecraft.net homepage
* {{bug|MCL-15376}} - useCoreError/index.tsx:84 uses the term "login", when it should say "log in"

== Trivia ==
* As a result of this version of the launcher adding Microsoft account support, players who bought [[Java Edition|Minecraft: Java Edition]] before December 1, 2020 don't need a Microsoft Account to play the game until all Mojang accounts are migrated to Microsoft accounts.
